intro: Trepadonia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its unique, spiky, and often blue or purple flower heads that resemble small holly berries. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Trepadonia species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Their flowering period usually occurs in the summer months, adding visual interest to coastal gardens.
